id: ISO 10962:2019, Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code
name: ISO 10962:2019, Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code

id: expression that specifies a calculation of a cash flow as a component of a cashflow formula
name: expression that specifies a calculation of a cash flow as a component of a cashflow formula

id: The calculation agent can also establish the price for a structured product and may act as its guarantor and issuer. If the counterparty in a derivative transaction is a broker-dealer, then they will often act as the calculation agent.
name: The calculation agent can also establish the price for a structured product and may act as its guarantor and issuer. If the counterparty in a derivative transaction is a broker-dealer, then they will often act as the calculation agent.

id: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add the concept of a credit derivative, modify the notion of an underlying asset valuation to be a kind of value assessment, and modify the concept of valuation terms to be a subclass of derivative terms.
name: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add the concept of a credit derivative, modify the notion of an underlying asset valuation to be a kind of value assessment, and modify the concept of valuation terms to be a subclass of derivative terms.

id: clearing house that enables parties to substitute the credit of the DCO for the credit of the parties
name: clearing house that enables parties to substitute the credit of the DCO for the credit of the parties

id: ISO 10962:2019, Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code, Fourth Edition, 2019-10, clause 6.8.2
name: ISO 10962:2019, Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code, Fourth Edition, 2019-10, clause 6.8.2

id: specifies a price for something on which the contract is based
name: specifies a price for something on which the contract is based

id: indicates that the notional amount is customized per a notional step schedule
name: indicates that the notional amount is customized per a notional step schedule

id: indicates that the notional amount is constant through the life of the contract
name: indicates that the notional amount is constant through the life of the contract

id: broker that solicits or accepts orders for derivatives that are traded on or subject to the rules of an exchange
name: broker that solicits or accepts orders for derivatives that are traded on or subject to the rules of an exchange

id: For example, suppose the initial price of share XYZ is $100 and a CFD for 1000 shares is exchanged. Both the buyer and seller must post some margin. If the price goes to $105, then the buyer gets $5,000 from the seller. If the price goes to $95, the buyer pays the seller $5,000. This contract avoids ownership of the stock and all the associated transactions issues (like stamp taxes). The contract also allows for leverage (typically 10:1) because the margin that must be posted is only a fraction of the value of the underlying asset.
name: For example, suppose the initial price of share XYZ is $100 and a CFD for 1000 shares is exchanged. Both the buyer and seller must post some margin. If the price goes to $105, then the buyer gets $5,000 from the seller. If the price goes to $95, the buyer pays the seller $5,000. This contract avoids ownership of the stock and all the associated transactions issues (like stamp taxes). The contract also allows for leverage (typically 10:1) because the margin that must be posted is only a fraction of the value of the underlying asset.

id: formula for determining cashflows for a derivative instrument
name: formula for determining cashflows for a derivative instrument

id: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move designated contract market to the markets ontology in FBC and eliminate the notion of NonPhysicalUnderlier, which was determined to add unnecessary overhead.
name: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move designated contract market to the markets ontology in FBC and eliminate the notion of NonPhysicalUnderlier, which was determined to add unnecessary overhead.

id: terms for a set of cashflows defined according to a mathematical formula
name: terms for a set of cashflows defined according to a mathematical formula

name: financial instrument and bilateral contract that is not listed on an organized exchange

id: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: This ontology defines basic terminology common to derivative and over-the-counter (OTC) contracts.
name: This ontology defines basic terminology common to derivative and over-the-counter (OTC) contracts.

id: indicates the cash value of one tick, i.e., the minimum price change of the contract
name: indicates the cash value of one tick, i.e., the minimum price change of the contract

id: indicates that the notional amount increases through the life of the contract
name: indicates that the notional amount increases through the life of the contract

id: The third party accepts the risk in return for payment, known as the premium.
name: The third party accepts the risk in return for payment, known as the premium.

id: listed security, given how blurry the lines are today, across derivatives.
name: listed security, given how blurry the lines are today, across derivatives.

id: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary, and to move the definition of an underlier and the related property, has underlier, to financial instruments so that these concepts are also available for use in relation to pool-backed securities.
name: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary, and to move the definition of an underlier and the related property, has underlier, to financial instruments so that these concepts are also available for use in relation to pool-backed securities.

id: indicates the party that is responsible for determining the value of a derivative
name: indicates the party that is responsible for determining the value of a derivative

id: Introducing brokers do not accept money, securities, or property (or extend credit in lieu thereof) to margin, guarantee, or secure any trades or contracts that result or may result.
name: Introducing brokers do not accept money, securities, or property (or extend credit in lieu thereof) to margin, guarantee, or secure any trades or contracts that result or may result.

id: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace hasContractSize with hasLotSize.
name: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace hasContractSize with hasLotSize.

id: indicates costs, such as up front costs, brokerage fees and the like, that must be paid on delivery
name: indicates costs, such as up front costs, brokerage fees and the like, that must be paid on delivery

id: specifies the final date on which a delivery notice can be issued
name: specifies the final date on which a delivery notice can be issued

id: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate hasThirdParty as a superproperty of hasCalculationAgent, which led to unintended reasoning consequences, added concepts and properties specific to settlement and valuation required for futures, forwards, and options, and moved general properties from forwards and swaps up to derivatives basics.
name: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate hasThirdParty as a superproperty of hasCalculationAgent, which led to unintended reasoning consequences, added concepts and properties specific to settlement and valuation required for futures, forwards, and options, and moved general properties from forwards and swaps up to derivatives basics.

id: Examples include credit default swaps (CDS), collateralized debt obligations (CDO), total return swaps, and credit spread options and forwards.
name: Examples include credit default swaps (CDS), collateralized debt obligations (CDO), total return swaps, and credit spread options and forwards.

id: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate duplication with concepts in LCC and eliminate a redundant subclass declaration in observable value.
name: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate duplication with concepts in LCC and eliminate a redundant subclass declaration in observable value.

id: specifies the initial date on which a delivery notice can be issued
name: specifies the initial date on which a delivery notice can be issued

id: Substitution may be done through contract novation, for example. A derivatives clearing organization (DCO) also arranges or provides, on a multilateral basis, for the settlement or netting of obligations, or otherwise provides clearing services or arrangements that mutualize or transfer credit risk among participants.
name: Substitution may be done through contract novation, for example. A derivatives clearing organization (DCO) also arranges or provides, on a multilateral basis, for the settlement or netting of obligations, or otherwise provides clearing services or arrangements that mutualize or transfer credit risk among participants.

name: terms setting out a cashflow structure of payments committed to by one party to a contract

name: contract terms specific to valuation of the underlying asset(s)

name: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of this ontology was modified to extend the definition of has notional amount, covering the variations allowed by the ISO CFI standard (DER-127) and to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate deprecations that are more than 6 months old.
name: DerivativesBasics.rdf version of the ontology was modified to eliminate deprecations that are more than 6 months old.

id: party responsible for making payments in a transaction specified in a contract
name: party responsible for making payments in a transaction specified in a contract

id: contractual terms specific to derivative contracts, including terms related to payments and delivery between parties
name: contractual terms specific to derivative contracts, including terms related to payments and delivery between parties

id: assessment activity to estimate the value of an underlying asset of a derivative
name: assessment activity to estimate the value of an underlying asset of a derivative

id: party that is responsible for determining the value of a derivative and in some cases, determines how much the parties owe one another
name: party that is responsible for determining the value of a derivative and in some cases, determines how much the parties owe one another

id: Derivatives, such as certain exotics, can be based on values ascribed to virtually anything, including weather. Typically, however, an observable value refers to something that can be readily observed in the marketplace, such as a quoted rate (e.g., interest rate, exchange rate), index value, commodity price, stock price, economic indicator, or something similar as of some point in time.
name: Derivatives, such as certain exotics, can be based on values ascribed to virtually anything, including weather. Typically, however, an observable value refers to something that can be readily observed in the marketplace, such as a quoted rate (e.g., interest rate, exchange rate), index value, commodity price, stock price, economic indicator, or something similar as of some point in time.

id: relates a derivative to contractual terms specific to valuation of the underlying asset(s)
name: relates a derivative to contractual terms specific to valuation of the underlying asset(s)

id: value for something discernible and for which evidence can be obtained
name: value for something discernible and for which evidence can be obtained

id: These contracts can also be on the difference of two assets' prices. They can also be on the difference of a single asset of different maturities (like a bond or futures contracts).
name: These contracts can also be on the difference of two assets' prices. They can also be on the difference of a single asset of different maturities (like a bond or futures contracts).

id: cash-settled derivative where the parties agree to exchange on the maturity of the contract the difference between the current value of the underlying asset and the initial value of that asset when the contract is initiated
name: cash-settled derivative where the parties agree to exchange on the maturity of the contract the difference between the current value of the underlying asset and the initial value of that asset when the contract is initiated

name: relates a derivative to contractual terms specific to the settlement process
